    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleDisplayablePhysicsPolygon

        public SimpleDisplayablePhysicsPolygon(float[] pointsX,
                               float[] pointsY,
                               int numberOfPoints)
        Creates a PhysicsPolygon from points specified by the arrays.
        Parameters:
        pointsX - The list of x coordinate points
        pointsY - The list of y coordinate points
        numberOfPoints - The number of points, because the program can't figure it out on its own

      • SimpleDisplayablePhysicsPolygon

        public SimpleDisplayablePhysicsPolygon(Vector2D[] points)
        Creates a new PhysicsPolygon from an array of Vector2D objects. It copies each one, so be cautious of using it.
        Parameters:
        points - the points to represent the PhysicsPolygon. They are copied over, not set to.

      • SimpleDisplayablePhysicsPolygon

        public SimpleDisplayablePhysicsPolygon(float[] manyPoints)
        Parameters:
        manyPoints - array of points to build the Polygon off of. It must be an even number of points in the format of "x1, y1, x2, y2...".

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage render(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bImage,
                                  java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        Description copied from interface: Displayable
        Draws itself to the image buffer The implementation of this method is a little wonky. You must set "g2d" to the bImage's graphics using "getGraphics" on the bImage, and casting it Then you can use the Graphics2D object to draw onto the buffer When you finish drawing onto the image, then return the buffer that you were given
        Specified by:
        render in interface Displayable
        Parameters:
        bImage - the reference to the image buffer to draw on
        g2d - a Graphics2D object to fill with the buffer
        Returns:
        the buffer that you were originally given

      • setDisplayLink

        public void setDisplayLink(DisplayLink link)
        Description copied from interface: Displayable
        Passes a reference for the Displayable object to use. This is for when you have an object you want to draw, but don't actually want to put all of the draw code into that other object
        Specified by:
        setDisplayLink in interface Displayable
        Parameters:
        link - the object that will be linked to this Displayable object
